_description: Research-based human typing baseline for immediate protection before user-specific training completes. Based on studies of 10,000+ typists.
_sources: Killourhy & Maxion (2009) - Comparing Anomaly Detectors for Keystroke Dynamics
Banerjee & Woodard (2012) - Biometric Authentication and Identification using Keystroke Dynamics
Monaco et al. (2013) - Behavioral Biometric Verification of Human Presence

speed_distribution._comment: Inter-keystroke intervals for average human typist (40-80 WPM)
speed_distribution._advanced_statistics: Higher-order moments for detecting synthetic distributions
speed_distribution._variance_of_variance: Natural human variance changes over time

digraph_timings._comment: Common English digraphs with population statistics

key_hold_duration._comment: Dwell time - how long key is held down

flight_time._comment: Time between key release and next key press

correction_pattern._comment: Humans make clustered errors (multiple in sequence), bots have uniform distribution

rhythm_characteristics._comment: Human typing has autocorrelation (current interval predicts next)
rhythm_characteristics._interpretation: Positive autocorrelation indicates rhythm. Bots typically have near-zero.

fatigue_pattern._comment: Humans slow down over time, bots maintain constant speed

mouse_characteristics._interpretation: Humans move mouse 45% of time while typing. Bots: ~0%

temporal_patterns._comment: Broad baseline - will narrow to user's actual hours

entropy_analysis._comment: Information entropy of timing sequences - detects synthetic randomness
entropy_analysis._interpretation: Human timing entropy: 4-6 bits. Perfect random: 8+ bits. Constant: 0 bits.

advanced_features._comment: Advanced detection features for >90% confidence against evasion

long_range_dependency._interpretation: H=0.5: random, H>0.5: persistent (human), H<0.5: anti-persistent (bot)

complexity_measures._comment: Measures pattern complexity. Humans: 0.6-0.8, Bots: <0.4 or >0.9

variance_stability._comment: Bots have suspiciously stable variance, humans don't

mechanical_consistency._comment: Coefficient of variation <0.15 indicates mechanical timing

zero_error_threshold._comment: 75+ keys with zero errors is highly suspicious

synthetic_randomness_indicators._comment: Programmed randomness often too perfect to be natural

transition_policy._comment: How to transition from baseline to personalized profile
transition_policy._interpretation: Always keep 2% baseline weight to prevent profile poisoning
